perturbation.original_text:
3. Annual Fees; Playoff Payment.
 
(a) In consideration for the Benefits, during each Contract Year of the Term, Sponsor shall pay Club, in accordance with this Section 3(a)
and Section 2(d) of the Terms and Conditions, the amount set forth next to the applicable Contract Year below (the “Annual Fee”).
 
First Contract Year (2018/19):
 $
200,000 
Second Contract Year (2019/20):
 $
204,000 
Third Contract Year (2020/21):
 $
208,080 
Fourth Contract Year (2021/22):
 $
212,240 
Fifth Contract Year (2022/23):
 $
216,490 
 
Sponsor shall pay Club the Annual Fee for each Contract Year of this Agreement in six (6) equal installments, each
due on or prior to the 1st of each month between June and November of the applicable Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text:
3. Annual Fees; Playoff Payment.
 
(a) In consideration for the Benefits, during each Contract Year of the Term, Sponsor shall pay Club an Annual Fee. The specific amount and payment schedule for the Annual Fee will be determined based on mutual agreement between Sponsor and Club at the beginning of each Contract Year.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines the Annual Fee amounts for each contract year. The changed text removes the specific amounts and states the fees will be determined by mutual agreement each year. This introduces uncertainty and contradicts the subsequent sections that might rely on a fixed Annual Fee amount.

perturbation.original_text:
b. Concourse Signage: Sponsor shall receive display of a Sponsor Mark or Advertisement on five (5) back-illuminated advertising
panels at certain locations on the Stadium concourses to be displayed during each preseason and regular season Jaguars Home
Game. The exact size and location of each panel shall be determined by Club.
perturbation.changed_text:
b. Concourse Signage: Sponsor shall receive display of advertising panels at certain locations on the Stadium concourses to be displayed during each preseason and regular season Jaguars Home
Game. The details of the size, count and location of each panel shall be determined per agreement between sponsor and Club.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies 'five (5) back-illuminated advertising panels'. The change removes the quantity and illumination requirement, now referring to advertising panels and introduces uncertainty on how many, where and their illumination. This is inconsistent if the original five advertising panels were the basis for the fees defined in section 3.

perturbation.original_text:
5. CONCESSIONS
 
a. Branded Concession Stands: During each preseason and regular season Jaguars Home Game and Other Events as requested by
Club or the Stadium concessionaire (“Concessionaire”), Sponsor shall have the right to display Sponsor branding on (i) one (1)
fixed concession stand in the Stadium located in the Bud Light Party Zone; and (ii) the fixed concession stand identified as
Concession Stand 118 on the Stadium concourse (collectively, the “Stands”). The exact size and location of the Stands shall be
determined by Club. The exact design of the Stands shall be mutually agreed upon between Sponsor and Club. Sponsor may
display Signage displaying a Sponsor Mark in and/or on the Stand. Sponsor shall be responsible for all costs associated with the
branding and Advertising in respect of the Stand.
perturbation.changed_text:
5. CONCESSIONS
 
a. Branded Concession Stands: During each preseason and regular season Jaguars Home Game and Other Events as requested by
Club or the Stadium concessionaire (“Concessionaire”), Sponsor shall have the right to display Sponsor branding on concession stands (the “Stands”). The exact size, locations, and design of the Stands will be determined at the sole discretion of the Concessionaire. Sponsor may
display Signage displaying a Sponsor Mark in and/or on the Stand. Sponsor shall be responsible for all costs associated with the
branding and Advertising in respect of the Stand.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines specific concession stands. The changed text removes the mention of specific location and makes the selection of the number and location of stands the responsibility of the Concessionaire. This can cause a contradiction and becomes an omission if the Annual Fee and Trade values are related to those stands.
